main event: A bright, round object was sighted traveling from southwest to northeast at 02:59:32 on July 4, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as being as bright as a first magnitude star or brighter.
The object was sighted 1 degree above the northern horizon.
The object disappeared as sunlight flared up, between the coordinates 252:52 W and 251:40 E.
The sighting was reported by NICOLAS - CIRUIZ.
The report includes the specific time, location, and trajectory of the sighting.
